page.title: 11Changes in Bangor
page.content: It is over 30 years since it was first agreed that a new hospital was needed for the area.Work was finally started on a new district hospital in 1976 and finally some two or three years behind schedule the new{Ysbyty Gwynedd}was opened in 1984. The old{Caernarfon and {Anglesey Hospital}site has been sold possibly to make way for a new supermarket. Changes are proposed to the{Wellfield {Shopping Area.}Within the last year over Â£1 million has been spent in giving it a facelift and now a further Â£2 million is to be spent redeveloping a substantial part of the complex. Included in the plans are a 20,000 square foot unit plus several other smaller shop units.
